text: Pours a hazy deep gold with medium frothy head. Aroma is fruity, mostly citrus, and funky yeast. Taste is very sweet, but enoyjable, not cloying. Body is great-- thick and a bit syrupy, which keeps it on the palate long enough to really experience the flavors, but not so much that its gross. Very mild hint of bitterness on the finish. Very enjoyable and well balanced. Cant detect the high ABV at all. First beer of this style Ive tasted.

On Draught
Pours a lightly hazy blonde color with a decent head and good lacing on the glass.

The aroma is nicely floral with some faint banana and soft mineral character. The aroma also has some sweet dough and some leafiness. Its complex enough but also inviting. 

The flavor is nicely fruity and spicy with a good herbal hoppiness throughout. There is some sweet dough and light banana up front but the beer is dry in the finish. The level of bitterness is a low to medium and is very well employed and balanced here. There is very little alcohol character here, Im very surprised to see that its 7+

Refreshing beer & its always cool to see someone pull out a successful attempt at Bière de Garde.
I like this one. Light florals and some citrus with a hint of booze and light funk. Pours golden without much head or lacing. Light sweetness in finish. Good package. Tao at pizzeria paradiso.
Draft. Slightly hazy golden amber color, small white head. Fruity aroma with banana, citrus, white pepper. Taste is also fruity, light funk. Decent.

Pint pour at Pizzeria Paradiso - Dupont. Poured a clear golden color with a small off-white head. Aroma was notes of tropical fruits, light sweet malts. Light yeast, funky notes. Coriander character. Tasty, easy drinking.

Draft sample. Poured a clear golden color with an average white frothy head that lasted and produced very good lacing. Moderate yeast and sweet citrus aroma. Medium body with a smooth thick texture and soft carbonation. Medium yeast sweet flavor with a smooth citrus sweet finish of average duration. Soft drinkable brew.
On draft at pizzeria paradisio it is a light golden with a slight head. The aroma is citrus the taste is strong bitter sweet that lingers spicey on the palate
On draft at Pizzeria Paradiso Alexandria. Pours a. Lear gold with an off white head. Aroma of tropical fruits. Flavors of banana and coriander. Slightly sweet smooth finish.

Draft at Dutchs. Pours a hazy golden amber color with a medium sized white head. The aroma and flavor have pale malts, lightly toasted, fruity esters, mild spices, light funk, some herbal notes, the aroma had some floral character, pretty interesting.

On tap at Dutchs. Hazy orange color. Pours with a big white head, that fades to a thin amount. Some splotches kind of loose splotches of lace. Medium body. Super smooth, kind of soft, lighter carbonation. Light dry finish. Nice mildly peppery aroma, some banana, mild floral, decent amount of hop, touch of lemon zest. Moderate sweet taste, light to moderate bitter. Alcohol is well hidden. Tasty farmhouse.
Draft at Blue Monk. Fruity aroma, minerally with a touch of vinegar. Fruity, minerally, touch of gauze, slight vinegar, slight tartness. Ok

Draft. Light amber gold pour, decent fpamy head. Smell is soft and floral, also clove and herbal. Flavor is interesting. Definite sweetness as expected but also a subtle tartness and plenty of spice notes. It is very clean and very christmas-like in character. Good beer for the season kind of a winter Belgian style bdg.

Sampled at the STL Hops 7th Anniversary Party - Pours hazy golden orange with a dense beige head. The aroma has nectar fruit, toast and basement must. It has a medium crisp body, but still lush and has minor sharp carbonation. The flavor starts with musty cellar funk, dry spices and toasty malt. The finish is much more traditional to the style than most US version. Quite nice.
